I had only ate at the Scottsdale location before and have never been so disappointed in the food before. I was so excited to come eat here for our date night, as it had been awhile since I ate their super yummy, melt in your mouth, have to eat every last bit, short rib nachos. I could only eat about 5 chips before I was over it, my husband devoured the rest. However, that is not saying much because he likes and eats EVERYTHING! On to the entree. I had my usual three taco plate, each taco I chose a different one. Short rib, carne asada and bbq pulled pork. With a side of beans and rice. Nothing and I mean NOTHING was edible. The short rib had so much black pepper in it my mouth was burning, carne asada had a burnt flavor, I don't know if it was actually burnt or not because I forgot to mention the place was so dark I could barely see the food. Lastly, the pulled pork, which I had high hopes for was just too salty! Rice had too much lime and the beans were hard and flavorless. I am not sure if the food was so bad because we got there an hour before closing but I do know for sure I will not be going to this location again! Oh and you know how I said that my husband eats anything? Well I couldn't even get him to eat my food so I definitely knew it wasn't just me being picky. The service wasn't great either, our waitress didn't even ask how everything was. It's not like they were busy, there were only 3 other tables and another waitress was there too. I didn't complain because my husband gets very embarrassed when I do so I just sucked it up as a $40 dinner date loss. Im not giving up on Blanco though, at least not the Scottsdale Blanco!

qX3EoKZZSfntiuO1ewUJ4Q.text: This place is great, their margaritas really pack a punch. But you can soak up their amazing flavor with a great burrito, their ingredients are high quality and the service is amazingly good and friendly. The staff are friendly and attentive and are great at anticipating your needs. The only thing I would change is that they use white rice in their burritos, although delicious- it should really be the red tomato sauce rice other than that, this place is a solid 5 star Mexican food restaurant. Bonus: They have a take out window for smaller on-the-go meals.

uL8gdLsEXiv6bdDos94r4g.text: There is nothing better than cooling off at Blanco's after a melting hot day in the Phoenix sun. This place is awesome and it only gets better as the evening progresses. Let's start at Happy Hour. So many fun drinks and appetizers.  I like Sangrias, which is on the Happy Hour menu. My husband gets the blood orange margarita, which is not on the Happy Hour Menu. We also ordered Happy Hour Nachos. They were small, but enough for 2. For dinner I ordered the chili verde burrito enchilada style. It was a lot of food. My husband ordered tres tacos without beans or rice. He got three different flavors, crispy shrimp, carnitas and carne asada. The drinks were great. The food was great. We were so full we had to take a small walk in the shouldering heat. You know I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tres tacos
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chili&#39;s verde burrito enchilada style

YOLYH3n9leLTMzXlcmszog.text: Our server Emerald was amazing! Starters she wished my mom and wife a happy Mother's Day which i thought was thoughtful and respectful! She made sure our drinks came out quick and let us know about the prickly pear margarita special!! They were amazing! When i ordered the shrimp tacos i forgot to say no mayo, so when they came i felt bad. Emerald told me it wouldn't be a problem to remake them without mayo and even offered me a appetizer while i waited for the new tacos. She was really a great server so did your going here make sure to ask for her!!!

liQ0vosJktJ0r74kJo8fow.text: This place was great. Really good food and amazing service. We had an issue with one of the meals but they handled it so well (these things happen). The manager came over and brought out fresh food along with comping our drinks. Would highly recommend.

UwCPvO5HuHSMtY0v2wBmeQ.text: Visiting Phoenix and wanted Mexican. We saw Blanco was listed very high on Trip Advisor. It was delicious!!! Our waiter was great, offered an explanation of the menu, offered a hotter salsa and offered us water and Pepsi to go. Will definitely try Blanco again!

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy Mexican!

niZG4HkLpW-xJZ3SVdNmUw.text: Just thinking about this place makes my mouth water. Definitely one of the best Mexican restaurants I've been to. In Arizona where there's Mexican everywhere, that means something. I haven't had a single thing here that isn't delicious, but their enchiladas are my favorite. I definitely recommend and I look forward to going here time and again!

3d-GGgV0q33olA5fZUmZYQ.text: We we were looking for a good Mexican food place that was not the typical hole in the wall. This food and restaurant exceeded our expectations. I am very picky with my Mexican food and Blancos was fantastic! Service was also very good as he was constantly checking on us and making sure things were going well. Was very happy we found this place. Delicious tres leches too!

CIw1OcwmyXspsk7nn1IDrQ.text: This spot just doesn't do it for me.  Flavors fall short.  Vegetables are over cooked and soggy.    The service is fine. The location is nice. Overall the food was mediocre.

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak fajitas

mnwg1UD2RAHQ-WJlOFeRzw.text: The only saving grace this place has is the customer service. Our waitress was sweet and tried her best to accommodate our taste buds but the food was just not willing to comply.  Jack N nailed it right on the head. He literally said everything that I had planned to write down for my review.  Like I always say you can always tell the quality of a Mexican food restaurant by the salsa, beans, and rice. What's the first thing they bring out? The traditional salsa and chips. The chips not bad. The salsa TERRIBLE! I should've known with the name Blanco that it was going to be super mild and bland. Seriously the worst salsa I've ever tasted. We tried to add pepper to give it a kick, but no. I even asked for a spicier option and the only other option was their roasted mango salsa, which was about as spicy as the other with our addition of pepper. Ok so it had a kick but not enough to kick it over the satisfactory scale for us. I've had better salsa's from a jar at frys.   We did actually have food and drinks. We ordered the nachos and a couple tacos. The beer was good, the Machaca and Chicken tacos were surprisingly good. The nachos, just like the salsa, lacked flavor spice and ingredients.   Given that it's Snottsdale I'm really not all surprised that they're still in business given their competitive Happy Hour prices in this area, even tho they fear the jalapeno.  So if you're a person who wants to play the Scottsdale uppity role, that can't handle the spice, just looking for some place to drink beer and snack on some decent street sized tacos this place is for you.

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Machaca Taco
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. HH Nachos
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salsa with added pepper

mu85kPAvdZ7bA_31n77G-w.text: I visited this place with my daughter yesterday for lunch around 1 PM.  I was sporting a Nike outfit so definitely not looking professional.  Why am I mentioning this? Read on...  Since we are vegetarians, we asked for substituting meat for black beans and give us gauc for rice since rice has chicken broth.  We mentioned if there's a charge for substitution, let us know.  BTW, this is not uncommon and pretty much all restaurants are used to this type of requests.  The Scottsdale branch is actually very good and the staff there offers vegetarians various options right away.  We chose to go to this branch as it was nearby from where we were yesterday and ignoring one of our friends telling us they didn't have a good service at this location.    Anyway, when the bill arrived, there were charges so we politely asked the waitress about these charges and she said she will be right back.  A few minutes later, her manager showed up and started saying, we don't give anything for free here.  We were in a disbelief as we could not understand what was going on and why he had be humiliate us in front of other guests.  My daughter didn't say a word, but I felt offended.  I asked the manager if he can explain what he was told by the waitress that he had to do this in front of everyone.    Apparently, the message from the waitress to her manager was that we were looking for free stuff!  The worst part, this came from the manager himself!  No wonder this place has pathetic service.  It was insulting.  An ideal manager would have first talked to the customer and provided a simple clarification like, sorry but we charge and that would have been okay.  We almost eat out everyday and definitely know that food is not free!  I had to tell the manager that I have never ever felt so uncomfortable and offended in a restaurant.  The manager didn't do anything to address this.  For our part, we paid the bill in full and even tipped the waitress.  Two wrongs don't make a right.  I guess I did my part by providing the feedback to the manager.  Word of advice for the chain and the manager - please listen to the customer first.  Also, if you judged me based on my clothes and reacted the way you did, shame on you.  Families do not always show up in formal clothes.  Please do not do this to any other customer as they may come there to spend time with their family or discuss business over a good meal.  No matter what the circumstance, people should be treated with respect.  It is not always the food that makes a restaurant memorable, but how the ambiance made a person feel. Overall, I would say I would remember this restaurant for its offensive service and would not recommend it to my coworkers, family, and friends.  UPDATE: I am updating this review based on the follow-up from the manager who actually took time to revert back on the issue and offered a sincere apology with a gift certificate to the chain.  if the issue had not occurred in the first place then I would have given it 5 stars for food and ambiance.  I am also hoping that my next visit to this place leaves me with a better impression.

IvRt3UeFkH9fn9EZAfGVVA.text: The classic margarita is spot on if you like a tart margarita! They make their own house sour which is a bonus. Happy hour prices are perfect to quench your thirst with little appetizers to fill your tummy! The chocolate on the churros is nice as well if you like dark chocolate. The only very disappointing factor is if you want to enjoy the tables outside of the bar, there is no table service. A bit odd when you pay all this money for quality food. Would be nice to have table service to make dinner/drinks a more relaxing environment.

FqNF_ynu6Plu0gmfKMsdVw.text: Whoa my gawd! Skip the restaurant and head immediately to the side happy hour window! I repeat! Head To The Happy Hour Window!!  I knew nothing about the pastor chicken taco...now I have dreams about the pastor taco! They should make that a sandwich..sorry..torta! It's so good it's stupid! AND it's only $4??!! What?!    I'm going to go back right now...just in case I get hungry later!  Moving along to the sandw.Sorry..tortas. Get one! Get some! You're welcome! You can thank me later.

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States

iL2YXnGIahmrsPwQyFbtyg.text: Today we met a good friend for lunch at the Blanco Tacos & Tequila location in the Biltmore Fashion Park.   It was a beautiful day and was adjacent to where we planned to hear an outdoor concert by the group Neon.   Blanco Tacos is moderately priced restaurant with a very nice variety of food and beverages.   Unlike your "typical" Mexican restaurant this place was not decorated in a Tex-Mex motif.   That said....it was a very nice and a very comfortable place to "catch-up" with friends.    We all ended up ordering different taco plates.   Mine was the more traditional hard-shell, ground beef taco.   The ladies had more class and ordered a variety of small, soft-shell tacos.   I don't think anyone was disappointed.   I also thought the chips and salsa were excellent.    We didn't have appetizers, two of us had soft drinks and our total bill was just over $50 before tip.   I'd go back!

O7IspWvqBZZ9DVXga1SLFQ.text: Horrible!!  I was told 15 minutes for a table. They asked for my cell phone number to get texted when a table was ready. I got a confirmation that they took the correct number down. Multiple people got seated before us and we never got texted. We are now enjoying tacos at a different establishment and these rocket scientists still haven't texted that the table is ready! It's been over an hour.

pPJBJnsyjMVrAIW6SkMTGA.text: When I saw the menu and the ambience, I was expecting an upscale, above average Mexican meal ( and service). Boy - was I disappointed!  The drinks were the only half decent part of the meal.  The service  was a) Inattentive b) Rushed and c)  arrogant ( one of the servers actually slammed the plate down and ran away without any eye contact. I had wanted to ask for a side of guac - but it took a whole 5 minutes before another server even came by. Then -'AFTER I had ordered the sides, it took another 10 minutes for me to get them. Simply unacceptable.  And the chicken inside my quesadilla ? Burnt and chewy - not edible at all. I left most of it on the table . And asked for the cheque.  Lo and behold - $7 for a side of guac and a $1 for sour cream.  I asked my server 'So sour cream and guac are NOT standard sides with your quesadilla ?'  And got a strong 'No' .   Then, he brought back the bill. And informed me that they had 'removed' the sour cream charge . Lol - a whole dollar off my bill - for something that NO restaurant in the world charges for. Crap -'even chipotle doesn't charge for sour cream!   Anyway - stupid place, stupid service , burnt food, okay drinks and okay interiors. I give them 2 stars - and hope to never see their trendy interior again.

0-D7vOaJ3jqsVsW2XE4k7g.text: A nice experience. The staff was great.    I had the avocado tacos.   Not a lot of flavor to them.  Something was missing.   The corn was great.   We got guacamole to start.  Good not great.   Don't get a frozen marguerita.  Something missing in that too  So a fun experience.  Food was average.

b2y_CGotCldnE30DBHhdjg.text: In my opinion the best Mexican food in az, amazing food, great staff, great atmosphere. I'm a regular here, it's also where my now husband and i had our first date.

Sn1QFEIjvNbdubwVWcSKIQ.text: I have had a couple of deliveries in the Camelback area and decided to sneak away with my boyfriend to this place across the street from one of my deliveries. I have to say Jen our bartender/server was amazing. We both had the micheladas  with Modelo and a Don Julio shot. Just one drink and I caught me a buzz which is a very good thing. We also shared an appetizer of the shrimp and lobster ceviche, I could've had three more bottles of this thing. I can't wait to come back again

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1R7MPVO6lYyMnxZlMoTLwA.text: My boyfriend and I recently had a late dinner at blanco. He ordered his usual, the red Chile chicken enchiladas and I decided to try the braised short rib machaca enchiladas. This time, we decided to go with the Mexican street corn instead of the beans and I was so happy I did. The corn was so flavorful and creamy!! I also enjoyed the short rib enchiladas even more than the chicken because there is a smokiness and spiciness to the machaca because of the ancho Chile. We were again very pleased by my visit to this restaurant and will definitely keep on coming for meals.

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Braised short rib machaca enchiladas
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States

IeEHmN_gPKC2ySu0drW7nQ.text: My husband and I wanted Mexican food last night and were frankly disappointed with our meal. The service was terrific however the margaritas were just 'eh' and the food lacked flavor.  My husband who was hungry left half of his enchiladas and I only ate one of my three tacos. With so many other fabulous options in Phoenix for Mexican food I cannot recommend Blanco Tacos. We won't be coming back.

pVDqb3olM5Od-wka4562_w.text: Myself, my boyfriend and our moms came in after a long drive from Las Vegas to Phoenix that morning, and apartment hunting all day. Exhausted was an understatement. Our waitress was very attentive, chips and salsa came out immediately, drinks were always full, food came out hot (huge plus for me). We were happy with our service and meal.   Fast forward a bit, I packed my leftover burrito (more than half) in the box and left it on the table. When I realized my complete absent mindedness, I went back but the table had been cleared. I found our waitress and she tried her best to find it, which I appreciate but we both knew it was long gone LOL. Anyway, she spoke to a manager, Hannah I believe, and she came over and offered to make me a brand new one because the waitress noticed I wasn't really eating!   I was pleasantly surprised, not just at the burrito but at the quality of service we received because, being honest, service can be scarce sometimes at other places.  Anyway, Hannah needs a raise because she's the best!

kg9D9OyfZANtVUwAjYqa9A.text: Solid place to for lunch. Tacos are unique and you get three per order to mix and match. I ordered the grilled avocado with spicy yogurt and the award winning bbq pork. The grilled avocado was ok but I expected more tangy/spicy flavoring. The bbq pork however was excellent and I could see how it won awards. The drink menu looked amazing, but I had some work to do today so couldn't daydrink. However, the margaritas looked awesome. Staff was friendly. Restaurant was clean. Noise level was loud as we hit the lunch rush. But there's an outside window option for a quick grab and go, and heck yeah they have the bbq pork taco there. If you're in the area, it's worth the stop.

lbG92wWYTIaf9uthsfNitg.text: Incredible! There was a small error (probably on our part in trying to make an online reservation) but the Manager was able to get us our table within 5 minutes of arriving and not being in their system as a reservation. WOW! We started with a Sparkling Sangria and a a classic Margarita (with their own house tequila)along with our chips and salsa we ordered the street corn. It was right up there with the best I have had. It's de-cobbed and comes in a small bowl. For only $5 I would get two next time if you are sharing. For our entries we ordered the Carne Asada bowl and the Green Chile Pork Enchilada. The waiter came by every 5-10 minutes and I was impressed with the service. We will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States

VqKDOoz31bmzeOwTt_gK3g.text: I love this place for happy hour! Totally great happy hour menu both drinks and food wise. I have once tried the enchiladas on the regular menu as well which were delicious. I'd highly recommend the dip trio or the cheese quesadilla. The margaritas are good too!

7FU4oPc_qJvmJN5Rbxe1uw.text: Had some torta sliders and quesadilla.  Great place to grab a quick bite and then walk off in the Biltmore shopping area.  I enjoyed the green salsa with my quesadilla.

16ll58PoQUJ_U1YhvfLo2g.text: I dined here solo a couple weeks ago and as Jordan (MOD) was seating me she asked how my day was. I replied honestly and told her that it was actually pretty rough. It can sometimes be awkward when a complete stranger doesn't reply with "good!" and gives your their honest answer, especially when there's like a 15 second window to "chat" with someone as your seating them at a table. She replied in a compassionate, professional way and checked on me periodically throughout my meal. I was touched by the way that she treated me like an actual human and took the time to get related to me. The food was delicious and my server, Kyle, also read the situation perfectly. I admit that I was in an awkward mood for Kyle to be taking care of me and he always showed up at the perfect time, gauged my pace perfectly and overall just made it as enjoyable of an experience as I could've had. He was there just enough, and also gave me the space I needed. Thank you Kyle and Jordan. You both turned my day around dramatically, just by letting me be where and I was and connecting with me in that space. This is True hospitality if you ask me. :) I look forward to my next visit. Thank you, again!

h-U-nxlV6afs-jzLBVcQJg.text: Salsa was amazing but it was a bad day for guacamole. The side of guacamole was an entire avocado that was hard and stringy.

2IGsnuvL9iejTPUUB_G-UA.text: I love Blanco Tacos! The atmosphere is so fun and inviting while the menu is full of unique, flavorful and creative options. This location is located in the Biltmore Shopping area and has nice outdoor and indoor options for dining. I love the inside because it makes me feel that, although we're in a desert, the beach must be nearby! It's obviously not, but hanging in with tacos, drinks and day-drinking music makes me feel like I've escaped the desert temporarily.   I've been here twice and the service has been fantastic both times. Quick, efficient and very accommodating. I just visited this location today with a group of four and we were seated right away. I usually struggle when debating between tacos, but Blanco let's you mix and match. Not only was I able to order three different tacos but my colleague ordered an enchilada that mixed two of the options available. Instead of ordering the rojo chicken or verde pork, she asked for the verde pork and it was no problem! Seems like a simple request, but I know we appreciated it!  I ordered the taco plate, which included: mahi taco, carnitas and the award winning slow bbq pork. Each had unique flavor and I was surprisingly full afterwards. We also shared queso dip at the table which was very addicting. Overall, I am a fan and am currently craving it as we speak!

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Queso dip
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos: carnitas, slow bbq pork &amp; mahi

Du3usyzWWHztaMmFn_qwdQ.text: Got a table quickly around 1:30 on a Sunday afternoon. The mango jalapeno margarita did not disappoint. My husband and I split the 2 combo fajitas (shrimp and chicken) and it was filling for a lunch portion. The refill of corn tortillas took an odd amount of time to receive but were delicious. We're in town for a couple of days but would definitely pop in if we visited again!

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States

2oMorfqDnyV3FmGZJjW0CQ.text: I enjoyed the complimentary chips and salsa with a green hibiscus tea and water while looking over the menu. My waitress recommended the hibiscus margarita... WOW. It was delicious (I asked for no straws). I ordered some of the blanco queso and some tortilla soup to warm me up on this chilly day. While I was unable to enjoy this meal with a friendmy waitress, Janice, made eating by myself a lot less lonely. I can't wait to come back and have Janice as my waitress and to try out other dishes and drinks! Cheers.   Update! Neli was my server today 2.28.19 and was fantastic! So friendly and made sure that not just my table, but every table was well taken care of. Very attentive and so nice! I can't get over how much I love this place! Ellie day us for the day and gave us the best spot possible. Can't wait to make another visit to Biltmore Blanco

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lunch for one please!

OJB0-aA34PPVtHOhQu8BSQ.text: Five stars evenly distributed:  1) Italian Blood Orange Margarita: Not too boozy, not too weak. Salt rim and lime on top.  2) Queso blanco: My favorite kind of melted cheese. I would've made this my entree with several baskets of chips. Luckily the group I dined with would've judged, so I ordered a "real meal".  3) Fajitas! Hot and steamy, like a meat facial, when they arrived at the table. It would've been good to split the dish... but I didn't. See point #2? I have little self control when queso is in the mix.  4) Good for groups: Having been a server in years past, large groups (8 or more people) are tough, no matter what. Rather than seat our crew of 16+ at one long table, they split us up into two groups of 8-9 each. Made for fast service and more intimate conversation. My water glass was never empty and food came out way faster than I had expected.  5) Location: Biltmore Fashion Park reminds me of the Stanford Shopping Center in Palo Alto -- indoor/outdoor combo, upscale shopping, lush greenery around. Definitely feels upscale even though you are in a mall.  This would be a great spot for work dinners, lady date happy hours, or a spot to take picky parents. I'd be down for any one of these options, as long as queso is involved.

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Italian Blood Orange margarita

-ganJ78jnX1l2Pw9p4onow.text: I go to the taco window at this particular Blanco establishment at least once a week for lunch. The prices are great, the food is fresh and delicious, but the best part of the experience is interacting with the welcoming staff. I talk with the woman that has blonde hair and vibrant eyes every time I eat there, and our conversations are great! For the most part, I am a loyal customer to this particular Blanco mainly because of the phenomenal staff & the woman at the window. I would give this place a 5 star rating easily.

z8reQndUFAb4oqz1abQXTw.text: Our meal was delicious but our service was a little bit slow, although very kind.  We waited a good 40 minutes until we were led to a booth that had been open the entire time.  With that being said, our waitress was very nice and suggested the chicken mole to my husband, which was fantastic.  We started with the ceviche, which included shrimp and crab and was fresh and flavorful.  The chips and salsa was also good.  I had the steak and shrimp fajitas, with street corn and rice, which was very good.  Their flour tortillas were yummy.  My daughter had a chicken and avocado cheese crisp, that was a good size and delicious.  We had classic margs, which were sour and delicious.  The service was a little slow, between courses, which is the only reason that I didn't give it 5 stars.

A5kPni8PfjFcyKFfUpBPYQ.text: The chips and salsa were pretty good for starters but I ordered 2 carne asada tacos and one chicken. The rice was overly salty and tasted processed. Blended lime margarita was like a slushy without tequila, (maybe they forget it) There was nothing special about their food and I don't recommend for you to come here. The prices did not fit the quality!

1kbcnH_DNSSGs1RYRphZOA.text: Nothing Rapido about this place and it's a total rip.  If I'm getting an $8 side salad or a $3 meatless taco I should at least get it in a reasonable amount of time.  Just order carry-out from the restaurant and get the adult portions in half the time for only a few bucks more.

mQCAuGDaRaO3raL2epzNIw.text: I have visited this location since it opened and always enjoyed the food, atmosphere and waiters. I have to say though, tonight was far better than any visit maybe even at any restaurant. They have certainly stepped up their game. Food was quick and delicious, our waiter was friendly and helpful, and everyone seemed like they genuinely liked being there. Great job, guys!

KbEuC1EAC_lZlVoIUOxyDg.text: Average food, which is strange for a fox restaurant. The service was just BAD!!! I had a margarita and after it was finished I put it at the end of the table as kind of a hint to ask if I wanted another, no go! After 6 pass by's from our waiter I walked to the bar to get it myself. My wife just had water and no offers to refill. After all that I talked to the manager and all I got was a "that's not right" then the bill came and no compensation. Can you say One and done?

R_HYaxvLuBDJ7RN3tALxdw.text: Best tacos at the taco festival! I had their beef machaca tacos. Their home made tortillas and the delicious spicy machaca made them my favorites.

bC_s9RG_Gvr8WFMhRSlXxg.text: A go to favorite. Never disappointed always happy with service and meals. The menu is diverse for all tastes. A consistent Fox concept restaurant.

44Jlz0EbjgtngI-9ioow1Q.text: This place really over rated paid 20 and food  was terrible. And I went with two coworker and they didn't like their food either. I had the steak fajitas and my friends had the cheese enchiladas which she return and then got the cheese crisp.

kmMmL5S58fLwOEyZ0d8sWA.text: Have been to the restaurant in March and to the grab and go window on April 11m during the outdoor movie.  Love to tacos - nice to have tacos that are fresh and not fried.  Great guacamole / chips and the service comes with a smile.

e5KD30uWvCu_XiozQea2fw.text: Vegetarians beware. Watch our for the flour tacos cooked in lard, chips in the same kettle used to fry shrimp and rice in chicken broth. This was not a good culinary experience.

NWAHj9yYc1K3zCmHYkbrLQ.text: The drinks we awesome not water down the appetizers were great. The poor boy sandwich was the greatest,  first time there with my sister for happy hour, sat outside and we really enjoyed ouselves.

xmqNpdNq5d8eevieUsZm6Q.text: I recently went to Blanco on a Friday evening with my boss. We were immediately seated as it wasn't too busy. We ordered a drink and some guacamole and some queso. Since she had to catch a flight we decided to order everything at once.   I ordered my food and when the server asked which beans I asked which ones have bacon in them, told her I don't eat meat and then took the black beans (no bacon). I then ordered the CHEESE enchiladas. When she repeated the order she said I ordered the chicken enchiladas, I said no, I don't eat meat (again).   My bosses drink came and then the guac and queso. No chips and no drink for me. Our server came by again and said my drink was coming and started to walk away and I said, excuse me... can we get some chips and plates. "oh yeah" another 5 minutes later she returned with chips but informed us the plates were still in the dishwasher.   Our food arrived and still no cocktail, I asked her again to check on it. I then tasted my food and thought it tasted funny, I took another bite and asked my boss to do the same, she informed me it was a meat sauce. I flagged down the server and asked her if it was meat and she said I don't know, let me find out. REALLY!! As a side note, I have never had this much trouble at a Fox restaurant, they seem to be completely clued in and know their menu). She came back and apologized and offered me something else. She also said she would tell her manager. Never saw a manager.   I am shocked at the poor service at this restaurant. I enjoy True Food on a regular basis and they are so professional and are very knowledgeable about the menu. I am not sure I will be returning to Blanco.   Perhaps more training is necessary.

UVyqlk33lqQhxBYkoWnE8g.text: Very poor quality food and drink . . . There at happy hour, and glasses tasted like soap. Don't order a White Sangria, as it is made with 80% sweet and sour mix from their margarita machine. Really disappointing.  The Quesadillas saved the day. They have a lot of cheese and a pleasant taste. But the Carnitas taco was the worst I've had -- just nasty. And the chips were greasy and right out of the fryer.   Very surprised. Sam Fox ought to do better. This was a relatively low-cost startup from Fox Restaurant Concepts in a location that has had other belly-up operations. This one is headed same direction, unfortunately. Love his "Wild Child" right up the street, however.

tpVbeu1DjEeSn64--bU44A.text: I went here for a birthday dinner and most of us got tacos and I wasn't all that impressed. The chips and salsa was probably the best place I've had chips and salsa though. The service was okay, not the best.  Kind of pricey. But I'm giving it four stars because I would recommend it and it wasn't a horrible experience. The chocolate fudge cake was absolutely amazing and worthy of 5 stars alone.

8yc4TgG7mwOzjVpoP2SVlw.text: Highly recommend this place on Fridays for happy hour! They used to have this guy named Taylor Ouellette playing all kinds of jams in the bar area. Really wish they would bring him back. Anyways, great food, great crowd, and good vibes!

6_Jq2HgIze29cz_t11k1dg.text: Im a fox restaurant fan Just finished a work party of 10 all separate checks. Arriving different times and had great service.  The short rib Nachos are the best great bartender a True artist

5Yup7aNFKC5FA9--k9IeCw.text: Simply amazing. Atmosphere is modern and elegant. We got the fish tacos - so delectable. Came out in less than 5 min. The fish was perfectly blackened and grilled. The chips were warm and not drenched in oil like most Mexican restaurants serve. The salsa was flavorful. Our server Gabriel was great! Very knowledgeable, friendly and attentive. Everyone was friendly. We loved our experience and will def be returning!!

fMOeYU3FiFNVbwbgTkjEuA.text: Good food & AMAZING service.  I believe that if a Mexican  restaurant has good salsa  its a good sign that the food will be good as well & Blanco has several. Our waiter Denver was spot on & made our "date night" extra special. We will certainly be back & definitely request Denver's section. Great job Blanco!

I2Rg5a5BXpsR-yvnB2tV1w.text: THE FOOD HERE IS INSANE GOOD!!!! had seviche, and shrimp tacos. Everything was insane amazing. The side of corn is to die. And the mango jalapeno marg? I'm in love. I want to go back every day

71IlStCmTyv0zcdRZTRyXQ.text: Great Great Great Great food Great service Great atmosphere  What can I say I love the place And it's walking distance from Embassy Suites

js04Wim8GQyUkuUih7PwVQ.text: A worst case scenario experience to say the least. Have been to this place several times and it has been consistently average across the board. We walked in and were seated right away. My girlfriend ordered their watermelon margarita with no chili salt. I ordered the tortilla soup and a burrito. The soup came out cold 20 minutes after I ordered it. And same with the burrito, it came out cold about 30 minutes later. Needless to say my girlfriends cocktail still had not arrived as we thought they forgot about it. When it did arrive about 30 minutes later it came out with the salt. Nearly everything we asked for was not accommodated. What a joke. Terrible experience, terrible service, ok food. Our server needs to take her job more seriously, as this was the sole reason we left. I guarantee that food just sat in the window and nobody ran the drink. Nobody asked us how we were doing, nobody stopped by, we were left to fend for ourselves. Then they just dropped the check off to us? Get it together! I just don't think it gets much worse than this!

EDP7bihrL7qFbR8e92Bdvg.text: Great food and freindly service! Luv this place I had a shrimp taco plater with charro beans with rice

gsSqZGUXz3sZyzEgw7KF4Q.text: Absolutely excellent! I ordered the virgin Red Berry Margarita which was fruits and refreshing. Their taco menu is totally customizable, so you can mix and match any three options. I got the Carne Asada, Chipotle Shrimp, and Grilled Mahi. All three were excellent! Our waitress was very friendly and helpful. Great atmosphere as well. Would definitely come back here!!

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos with rice. Carne Asada is on bottom, Chipotle Shrimp is middle, and Grilled Mahi is on top

X0tcB5IyQbsnR4u-hexVkQ.text: I really enjoy their food. They have a great happy hour menu and if you are in a rush, they have a quick stop order window, which I like to order their po-boy shrimp sandwich. They also feature various aguas frescas (fresh fruit drinks) depending on what is in a season. They also have such great waiters and waitresses who exemplify great service. Try it out!

gE-W5CYbdNIyj_fL_MQ0_g.text: Very rarely come here for dinner. Came on this Friday night. Busy with a lot of people and a lot of people noise. Which ok. What is not ok is the background music which is not music, but rather boom boom boom boom. How does anyone sit in there with this ear aching constant boom. No longer will I come for dinner, only lunch. Great food should not be ruined by boom boom boom.

Fx60c2Bf2WCoPEPddhTEkw.text: On a whim (and because we were hungry), we decided to try this place, especially as it was recommended by a relative. We went for lunch and sat outside. So nice not to have to brave the snow that others around the country are having to deal with. The waitress was very helpful and she gave us some great food suggestions.  Two of us had three tacos each and the third member of the group had a burrito. We were all very pleased with our choices and we all cleaned our plates. I had a Negra Modelo on tap which was perfect.  Our waitress could have been Penelope Cruz's double (well, maybe when PC was a few years younger). She added a little extra zing to the meal! Definitely a fun place for lunch in the sun.

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Protection from the elements.
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My tacos.
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Entrance!

qB28zpDY5JvFY8WoaX7lkg.text: Our waitress was Penelope Cruz or her doppelganger.  Penelope made some recommendations. Me? I ordered the Green Chile burrito (not on her list of recommendations). While the burrito was very tasty, perhaps a bit on the heavy side for lunch, the fresh-looking tacos that were served up at my table for my companions looked sooo yummy. I only ate half of the burrito and learned you want to listen to the recommendations from Penelope!  The chips and salsa were yummy. If you decide to order the burrito (even when Penelope is recommending something else), don't eat all the chips and salsa first, leave room for the main entree.  Plenty of inside and outside seating. We opted for outside as the weather was perfect.  I'll definitely come here again, but I'm listening to Penelope next time! She knows her food.

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Green chile pork burrito
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. View from our outside table

U8wJ2Jkd_CICHYq3nddZBA.text: Came here for a work lunch.  My co-workers got the Mexican chopped salad which they really enjoyed.  it looked pretty healthy.  We shared the guacamole for an appetizer.  It wasn't my favorite guacamole, needed a punch of something more sour or salty or something!  I preferred the free salsa and chips they give you.  For my entree I got 3 tacos: short ribs, pork, and fish.  They were all really tasty!  Came with a side of rice and beans that was just pretty regular.  The atmosphere inside is nice, I enjoy dining in there.  I think in the fall and winter it'll be nice to hang out on their patio.  I will be back!

IeFVttx1FN6gEc2GcEOmzg.text: Food was on point and service was friendly. My favorite part of the meal was the Mexican chocolate cake. Dessert prices were reasonable compared to other places and this cake is a must have for chocolate lovers.

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican Chocolate Cake

DmyXoQV1BZhFybCFfnnD7w.text: We sat at the bar and very much enjoyed the bartenders friendly knowledge about tequilas and general conversation. They recommended a great drink for my husband, one he never would have tried on his own. The food was good and it generally seemed like a good place to hang out for a bit - loved the doggie friendly patio! :)

I_-WvcWZNhUjPwVe_ah5RQ.text: Excellent happy hour!  I love this kind of place where they serve  the HH menu at a dinner tables and our comfy booth.   The 3 sauce dip was outrageously good-  we gobbled up that cheese sauce and guac, and the charro bean dip was delish too.  Kids quesadilla was a big portion.  Street tacos are small but full of deep flavor.  I'd come back anytime!

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy hour

MIAgcMe8A_dgFPJ06xzILg.text: This place is awesome!!! The service  is great the food is amazing, all of the tacos are great, but you must try the pork belly one and fried chicken with chimichurri sauce, to die for!!! Will be back soon!!@ plus great tequilas and beers

BdcQQR5aKm_36EVQTMluGQ.text: This was my first visit to Blancos. My experience was just fine from a customer service and atmospheric standpoint, but I wasn't particularly in love with the food. I had the Caesar salad (definitely not bad, but in no way evoked the spirit of its namesake) and carne/chicken fajitas. The meat was actually pretty good (its marinated, and I wasn't disappointed in the flavor profiles at all). The side of guacamole/sour cream/pico was a little stingy. Overall, not a bad experience; I might come back for a drink sometime.

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States

AAuJ8KuUiP5ayoxVfCSYRg.text: I came to Phoenix for a conference at the Biltmore hotel. I found this place on yelp and decided to try it out. It has inside and outside seating. It is happy hour today, starting at 3pm. They give you complimentary nachos and salsa. Chips are homemade and the salsa is ver good.   It has a balance of flavor and bite. There is a separate menu for the happy hour. I had the sparkling sangria that was recommended by the waiter. When I saw it, I thought it was petite. It was not manly enough for me but it turned out pretty good. I tried the Machaca Beef taco and the Crispy Shrimp po boy torta. The taco at first tasted bland but as you eat it you start to feel the tingling of the habanero salsa hitting you. Just an awesome flavor. The torta on the other hand is more of a sandwich. I didn't feel anything from it. All in all, it is a great place to happen by as you shop or stroll by after coming away from a conference day.

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is the Machaca beef taco
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is the Shrimp po boy torta

yW06qOm_fHYJAxBdK1BKpQ.text: Blanco Tacos + Tequila never disappoints. The staff is always so friendly and their tortas are heaven!!! Ask to be served by Samantha. She went above and beyond to make sure our orders were perfect because I am very specific. It's nice to see that Harry is still the GM. He does a great job running the place. Great boss = great employees

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. These margarita&#39;s are working their magic
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This spicy machaca beef torta  My taste buds are so happy right now. If you have not tried these, you should!

a5WY4qr--wgd6750j-nZiQ.text: Wow!! On a quick trip to PHX stopped in this place because I liked the name. Happy hour is the time to come because the margaritas are $5 and the happy hour menu is discounted. I walked away very full and happy!! Spices are just right and the staff very friendly and helpful. This is a no brainier, if you are here, stop in. You won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy hour tacos!!

shmlFTeYKVn0aOR8avBMCw.text: Great food, great service. Can't get better Han a $6 marg for happy hour. Unlimited chips and sals. Tacos were great. The churros were fab.

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States

38KiPghzr-cVAW1gDQNE4Q.text: The tacos, quesadillas, and ceviche are great. The atmosphere is great and so is the service.   During the day, bring the grandkids, I do and they love it!

dPPxHSn9gRslyHFOMaG5eg.text: We ate here twice on our trip to Phoenix and we never do that! Amazing drunk selections and fresh ingredients.  Prices are reasonable staff helpful and friendly!

ogHYNm8Vl5pUTl7IaW75qQ.text: Our friends invited us to Happy Hour at Blanco Tacos + Tequila. While we were familiar with the surrounding restaurants and area, we hadn't visited this establishment yet.   With a very open and lively interior, the high ceilings made the room feel huge. We decided to get a table outside as it wasn't too hot with the outdoor misters on. While they cooled us down, the misters were set so that our table and seating (and drinks) were getting wetter than what we were willing to tolerate. After a first round of margaritas and taco's, we chose to switch tables in a shaded area away from the misters. By this time, the temperature had cooled off a bit to where it was still tolerable.   Our waitress was very kind, attentive and pleasant. I opted for the margarita and the pink sangria as beverages and tried a portion of the pastor chicken taco and the carnitas taco and was very pleased. For $3 tacos and $5 drinks, this is definitely a nice spot to check out; we'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pink Sangria
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Margarita

RMCk11_vv5YLLQcNpoyZQQ.text: Our server was great with Ilya, I forgot his name but he definitely took good care of myself, either in law and mother. The drinks were delicious and my margarita definitely hit the spot. I got a burrito and it was absolutely  heavenly, I however did not know the square comes right on top of it, so it was more of a fork and knife burrito. I wonder if the sauce could come on the side and I can just eat the burrito as it is meant to be eaten, with my hands. I'll ask for that next time.   The chips and salsa that cocked complementary at every table were definitely appreciated.   Can't wait to come back.

VFkHtga1iruJk5_De3ECFA.text: So my friends and I went to Blanco Tacos for a birthday celebration.  I have never been there before and wasn't quite sure what to expect.  The atmosphere was cozy, I would say would probably be a great place for a first date or even just a small group outing which ours was.  We were seated in a booth (party of 5) and it was quite comfortable.  We ordered our drinks and they made sure that they stayed full.  And we ordered our food.  Four of ordered tacos; and one ordered a bowl.  The food was good and even though three of us were ordering keto our waiter made sure that it came out correct for everyone.    So the reason the I am writing this review is because of our waiter, Raymond.  We as a group have gone out to several restaurants and I have to say that Raymond made this experience extremely pleasant.  He had a great sense of humor and even laugh when I did some things that the other four had disagreed on.  He claimed he didn't know Keto so when it was ordered he was like " o ok this sounds good but I want what's missing".  We offered him some Keto cake which he had on his break real quick and came back to say it was good,especially with strawberries...making myself think darn why didn't I think of that.    All I am going to say is that if I go back;no correction when I go back.  I'm calling ahead to see if Raymond is working and I am requesting his table.  And I never do that.    Raymond if you read this.  Keep up the awesome work.

i7g41tqA9fSWUfnWnlz0cg.text: Amazing visit to another Fox Concepts restaurant. Decided to use the 25% off for Memorial Day email discount - which is an amazing way to try a new place.   My husband and I love Mexican food and just have not got around to trying this place out.   The indoor seating at the booths had a bit of a draft, so we ended up going with hot entrees.   I ordered the cheese enchilada which was spot on amazingness! If you love melted cheese this dish is a dream come True. I went with the beans (charro) but substituted out the rice for the street corn ($2 more but so worth it). You can choose to substitute out either the rice or the beans.   My husband ordered the tortilla soup which he enjoyed but found spicy. He ordered the street corn appetizer (it's the same size as the side on an entree). We also asked for limes from our waiter which we think is a must for the corn!  Nachos and a red salsa come complimentary to the table which are tasty.   Service was quick and efficient and our waiter was amazing! Be sure to ask for Raymond as we hope we see him next time we are back.

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing, cheese enchiladas and substituted out the rice for $2 extra street corn.
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Love the decor.
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Complimentary!

-IvT7LZGqEfbMJRWAzCpzg.text: I'd return for happy hour specials, Monday - Friday 3 - 6 PM. Nothing like sipping margaritas and snacking on complimentary chips and salsa.   Hibiscus Flower Margarita $6 Happy Hour: This was really tasty and hit the spot.   Sparkling Sangria $5 Happy Hour: This was good as well, but of the two I liked the margarita better.   Street Corn $5: I wasn't too hungry so just got this to snack on. I love street corn, and having it off the cob just makes it easier/less messy to eat. I think you can also substitute this as a side for entrees, which I would recommend!   *****  My Star Ratings:  1 Star - Terrible. Just thinking about it makes me angry.  2 Stars - Meh. Unlikely for me to return.  3 Stars - OK. Open to coming back, but wouldn't go out of my way to.  4 Stars - Yummy! Will definitely return if I haven't already.  5 Stars - AMAZING!!! Would plan my day or even a trip around eating here.

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. &#34;Esquites&#34; Mexican Street Corn $5
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sparkling Sangria $5 at Happy Hour
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hibiscus Flower Margarita $6 at Happy Hour

Dob6SULNKBoyhhIGhcCWjA.text: Some friends and I were staying at a resort for a staycation. We decided to do dinner offsite since it was the last night. We took an Uber to Blanco which was all of 5 min and we couldn't have made a better decision for dinner. First allow me to say that our waiter Corey was PHENOMENAL. He was VERY attentive, offered great suggestions and was truly a pleasure. And though we saw that he had quite a few tables, no table's service was left undone, as far as we could see. He even informed us that he's there Thursday night and weekends I think because he works another job. But if by chance you ARE dining at Blanco's on these nights, REQUEST COREY. (Btw, this is not a paid advertisement) lol. He's just that good. I ordered the crispy shrimp tacos that had jalapenos and some sort of slaw. The rice and beans were great as always. The tacos were as well. Believe it or not the tacos are very filling. I wasn't able to eat all of them. I wish I could have because it's not a dish that I wanted to take to go just because reheating would require removing the finishings. Not to mention reheating shrimp  To say the least, we were all pleased with our dishes. The customer service was great. We had no wait and were able to be seated immediately. I'll certainly revisit again, but onlyyyyyy during the nights that Corey works. It's going to be hard to top the quality service that we had.

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crispy Shrimp Tacos

X5k7sb2hQ7lZp90ePhkZZA.text: Blanco is consistently decent. You always can expect the food and drinks prepared the same way but it is not "authentic Mexican food". The rice does taste a little "uncle bensey" but it's still good. I like the service and the chips and salsa is always good. I also like that you can swap green sauce for red or vice versa in dishes and order mixed meat taco plates. So they're good but don't expect a True Mexican food experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Enchilada sub cheese (no meat) and sub green sauce.
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos. All different

UWCCkyWdnpRstBAo7hMirw.text: I love this place! Always friendly quick service and amazing salsa! We tried the seasonal Watermelon  Margarita made with fresh watermelon juice, so good! Queso was great and the bbq pork & roasted corn quesadillas were delicious.       To add to the great food was the lovely weather so we sat outside, making for a perfect evening!

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quest
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Watermelon Margaritas!

LY8nJL_jht7rR0xWiPNTXg.text: Packed with people on Taco Tuesday over here! Came here with a few of my girls and we all absolutely loved our meals. I ordered the brisket and avocado quesadilla and it was super good! The brisket was so soft and juicy. I ate two slices and was stuffed. The only downside was it was so cheesy and I ate it so late in the evening so it just sat so heavy.   We also split a flourless chocolate cake with ice cream, highly recommend it! You'd think it would taste off, but it was lovely and packed with chocolate flavor.   Our server was super nice. The restaurant was very clean.

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Flourless chocolate cake
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brisket and avocado quesadilla

plDYHOI1EwbEMziLso-sQQ.text: A cross between casual + fine dining. Attire from jeans to semi formal are appropriate. Food and service is top notch. The ceviche was a large portion and went very well with the warm chips. The complimentary chips and salsa were fantastic; not your typical watered down salsa! The steak burrito was amazing!! As was the tacos; you can mix & match the tacos. Happy hour. Starters to entrees are delish! Full bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States

VUwk7Smg_bu8Z5spxNz3Ng.text: Eclectic and modern space for a taco place with great customer service especially on Christmas Eve. The bar closed rather early but the manager made an exception and got us a couple of drinks. ...also, replaced my sangria with spicy Rita with no fuss. Food was good, the tacos we're ok, tortilla soup a tad bit salty and the ceviche could use more lime. The restrooms are on the lower level.... overall a good experience, will certainly revisit!!

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States

RMqSLPKU57xF2Lhy_ferDA.text: The tacos were very delicious and fairly priced. I really liked the fact that they had the window where you could walk up and place your order. Very convenient for grabbing food on the go as you shop.

wD9zRY9KwY0Vo9n3vgfDWA.text: Went to lunch on a glorious Fall afternoon. The restaurant is cool and hip. Greeted and seated immediately. Server at our table within minutes. Drink order taken and returned in minutes. Our server was exceptional asking if we had ever been before and gave us the monthly margarita, prickly pear. Sounded delicious but not on a work day. My dining companion and I decided to share a short rib and avocado quesadilla. After taking our order she brought a small bowl of thick tortilla chips and a mild salsa. The chips were too thick for my liking but they were fresh and the salsa was good. She did bring a couple of others, a verde, a chipotle and another that was supposed to be more spicy. All salsas had good flavor but they were all mild to me.  Quesadilla arrived in about 10 minutes. Picture perfect, griddled to a golden brown. Meat was tender and the pico blend was good. My only complaint is it didn't have much avocado. Small cubed pieces that I only got after every 3rd or 4th bite.  The food wasn't anything spectacular but the service was above average and during the lunch rush quick. A solid dining experience and I would love to go back to try other menu options.

J27hZNTq07d4KPFwljzySg.text: Great meal and great service. The poblano and tomato cheese crisp was delicious. Taco variety is vast and the ones we tried, shrimp, chicken and ground beef all prepared well. Will be back to try other items on the menu.

mmzxKaaOOrjCLV0ONnbL1A.text: Came in today for the first time. They give you complementary chips and salsa. The chips and salsa were good. Nothing special. We also got the nachos with short rib, it's just $3 more to add. The nachos were super delicious. They do fill you up.   Then I ordered a taco plate comes with 3 tacos which I picked 3 different ones, the short rib, carne asada, & baja  chicken. It comes with rice and beans I choose the pinto beans it comes with bacon. The best taco is the short rib, it was so flavorful and has abit of a kick. The carne asada was good, it would be my second choice. The baja chicken wasn't that great. Also my brother got the carne asada burrito. My sister got the kids quesadilla. The kids quesadilla was huge.   I was surprised how fast our food came out. It was quick.   I wanted churros for dessert but they only make it during happy hour.   They do have a basement which you can use the stairs or elevator. The bathrooms are in the basement. They also have a party room down stairs.   Love the decor inside. Also they do have a patio to sit outside.   Also you can validate your parking coin here.   They do take reservations.

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Patio
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bathroom

u5YTXwSAwfDq856iErU96w.text: Great lunch spot! Open air restaurant so great eating outside when sunny and inside when to hot.  Had the Pork Verde Bowl. Very flavorful and not to heavy on the stomach. Chips and salsa were good too. Some places just have bad chips, these are great.  Recommend as a good spot for a business lunch.

zhpjJVDEFJSYuceqJb7EOw.text: I've been checking out fox restaurant concepts and Blanco Tacos was one that I have not tried. So naturally, a trip home to Phoenix, I had to at least go to their happy hour.   We came at around 4pm. We were seated immediately and was given waters straight away. Our waiter, William, introduced himself and gave us plety of time to review the menu. We started with a couple of sangrias. William pointed out which ones were more sweeter or more of a classic taste. We were happy that our server was so attentive to all these details.  We got the trio dip that included cheese, bean dip and guacamole. William brought out the salsa and chips straight away.   We had about 2 of the sangrias and then switched to the margaritas. We got the classic as well as the berry flavor. The berry/pomegranate (I think) was a bit too sweet and sour for my taste. William was able to switch it out!   We got too full with all the chips and dip that we never made it to the tacos and main entree!!! I'll have to return to check out all the amazing options on their menu.   The layout of the restaurant was also very inviting. It seems they have a private section downstairs for parties. Bathrooms were also down stairs.   I'll be sure to return. If you check out Blancos, ask for Wlliam. His service and friendliness is pretty awesome!   Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States

2bLhGyvOKbrc5ILo0vJVGw.text: After a little shopping at the Biltmore, this was a nice way to spend a Sunday afternoon lunch. We were seated immediately and not only was the hostess pleasant, but our server, Alexa, was quite friendly and helpful too. I ordered a seasonal margarita with pineapple and jalapeno which was divine.  Chips and salsa were on our table in no time. As for our lunch, I had the grilled avocado tacos...really there are no words- they are so good! My lunch mates had the red chili chicken tacos and a chicken bowl and there were no complaints at our table. Everything came out in a timely manner and tasted fantastic. The three of us ate and had three drinks for just over $60.00.  And it was worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1b96T6x7DjJAqgvzBGiBOg.text: Good tacos!!!  Tried this today and thought everything was very good.   I had the carne asada tacos. Very well cooked and season to perfection. The spicy Avocado and butter sauce added to the tacos.   Big restaurant with lots of TV's. Service was very good and friendly.   In all I would definitely eat there again and may do so tomorrow.   Update.... went back again today and the tacos were just as good.

E7SGSsX5XaofMs00uzaNVw.text: "Thank youuuuuu for bein' a friendddduh,   Traveled down a road and back again!   Your heart is True, ....you're a pal and a confidaNNNNt.... . . . .....aNNNd if you threw a partAAAy,   Invited everyone you knew-woo-whooo!  Well,... yew' would seeeeee, the biggest gift would be from meeeeee,  And the card attached would sayyyyy, "THANK YOU for BEING A FRIENNNND!" __________________  What are the odds that - that classic Golden Gay (***coughs***) I mean, ....urr, uhm, "Golden Girl" track that soared this epic series to fame was written by (of all names) Andrew GOLD?  Talk about ironic.  So whilst in Phoenix with colleagues, I/we bypassed this vibrant Mexican eatery when in route to "True Food Kitchen" just around the river's bend.  At first glance, "like spotting a good man", I knew I'd be back to blow .....(***coughs again***) some of my paycheck here.  (I should really consider purchasing Claritan to remedy all of this coughing)  Doling out modern flares from the uppity Biltmore Fashion Park........with more tequilas and beer on tap than I'd have been willing to count, this colorful, modern contemporary space encompasses rustic elements throughout, alongside spacious bars and a wrap around patio that my counterparts from out of state simply couldn't pass up.  .......110+ degrees outside......       "Why not sit OUTSIDE ON THE PATIO???"  O__o  Ahhh, white people, GOTTA' LOVE YA'! Heatstroke just does NOT serve as an option to you guys, does it??!  Taking one for the team (my benefits package kicked in months ago), .....while awaiting our outside table FROM INSIDE, we elected upon standing bar side to people watch while cocktail sipping, whereas we PROMPTLY took note of some Sugar Daddy attempting to woo his unappreciative young golddigging hussy of a date with booze she simply did not care to sip!  (This would NEVERRRR happen in California)  Our hoez' are just too darned high maintenance!  But would y'all believe that this chick requested a drink and just LEFT IT SITTING there.......(that's not the crime).....  ....DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF ME????!  Was she unaware of Kenny G. and his 5 star rep-???       This deserves a quote:  {{*** Blanche: There is a FINE LINE between having a good time and being a wanton slut. I know.... My toe has been on that line. ***}}  Hah!!!  As I've mentioned before, ....alcohol SIMPLY DOES NOT go unconsumed within my house and AFTER inhaling her unsipped libation (from a DIFFERENT straw,... because I'm "classy"), Yelp I'm here to testify towards its being just as delightful as the 5 other beverages I downed that evening!  HeLLLooo......and GOOD-BYE!  In addition to a short wait time and nominal provender (the salsa/queso blanco sampler, street tacos, burritos and fajitas were all pretty decent), CUSTOMER SERVICE here was STELLAR and despite temps soaring higher than a giraffe's cooch, somehow ...... SOMEWAY, we still managed to receive our meals on time.   Another plus. ^  Sadly this place doesn't exist within So Cal rendering it upon my fave 5's as a newfound noshery to visit when traveling back this way to good ole' "Apache Junction".  Blanco....  Blanche....   Whatever you're calling yourself these days guRRRL', I duly THANK YOU FOR BEING A FRIEND!

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Had I known our hotel rooms didn&#39;t possess refrigerators I&#39;d have SERIOUSLY considered downing all of this here to prevent wasting it!
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Have mercy! They did NOT skimp on the shrimp within this fajita plate!!!!
Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I&#39;ve honestly had better chips and salsa but it paired well with the tacos, so I digress.

dVZUDoKoG-TeZY3djBvBhQ.text: We're from Southern California so we know good Mexican Food but this restaurant is by far the best we've had. Not only is the food amazing but the service and atmosphere made it all the more enjoyable. Our server, Paige, had some great recommendations which we would not have tried otherwise and we were so glad she took the time to go through the menu and make sure we were taken care of. Amazing service and great food, what more could you want? If you only have a short stay in the area we recommend you grab dinner here, we only wish they'd come to CA!

acmA_EpM3ZhMDLvAT7wZ4Q.text: The food here is mediocre at best.  For the price of this place, I'm expecting authentic Mexican cuisine.  What I got?  A plate full of over-salted meat.  I've tried this place 3 times now, trying to give it a fair chance, but I just don't have anything nice to say about it.  They obviously aren't familiar with cooking Mexican cuisine because I got no hints of herbs and spices typically used.  Everything is over-salted to make up for the bland food.  I walked away each time with a throbbing headache from the mass amounts of salt I consumed.  I think that because this place is sandwiched within the Biltmore shopping center, people think the place is good.  But trust me, you're better off saving your money and finding somewhere better to eat.

p0Tw-qw68MHNreDQc-nv7g.text: the food was awful and expensive for what you got the service was great and I liked the fact you can sit outside

v7SW9szZ_gan4FKvBHkEkA.text: Excellent food.  But honestly, skip the Biltmore location and go straight to Scottsdale.  Service is pretty spotty at the Biltmore.

js8iEuoooMH_yKc4HMCahw.text: Good restaurant.  I've been here about 3 times.  Nice ambiance and decor.  Service is always good.  The food here is a little meh however.  Tried several different tacos and I find them all a bit bland. Except the BBQ Pork which was excellent.  Taco's aren't bad, just not very flavorful.  The Blanco Burger is good.  It's worth a visit for the drinks though. They are strong and tasty.  This is a nice place to grab a drink and relax before or after dinner but I wouldn't come here hungry.

7Wfzjq6k7ojTXYoVxytXLw.text: This place has great food and service. When we came for the first time the waiter was so helpful and recommend some favorites. The atmosphere is really cool. The menu has a good selection and everything is made fresh. They make their own juices and salsa. I had a great overall experience and would definitely come back.

EbIe_VXfQ9FfenKAO5F8zQ.text: Came here for lunch on 6/3 as a party of 2.  My experience was so bad they comped my meal without me complaining whatsoever (slow service, wrong food, excessive time).  Fox Restaurants tend to not be very good (in my experience) and should be avoided if another option is available.

X3Tv0K6I_7LyAWTDUModRw.text: My wife and I have eaten here twice in the last two weeks. On both occasions, we were greeted promptly and with great enthusiasm by our server Dyana who provided the best care and service we've ever had. Furthermore,  manager Marlo stopped by to check on us and provided amazing customer service. On our second visit, we asked for Dyana and not only did she remember our names she remembered our order from our first visit. Marlo stopped by again, and without missing a step continued off from where we'd left off a week prior. Food was amazing both times and everything was clean and spotless. Bathrooms are downstairs, limiting bathroom traffic where you're eating and they were super clean! I would recommend this location to anyone, any time. Looking forward to our next visit and ready to try a mix and match taco combo!

mX0LJ7MJitGk0YUrePKqZg.text: Have tried this place three times now. And only once have I met a staff member I liked. Our server this time was older, bubbly, and knew what she was doing. When came in on a late sunday afternoon, it was fairly slow. We told the hostess that we'd like to sit on the patio and she happily obliged. She took us out and tried to seat us directly next to a couple that seemed to be deep in conversation and enjoying each other. The seating on the patio is pretty tight, but the whole damned thing was empty! Why would you seat us right next to the only people on the patio? My boyfriend laughed a bit and asked if we could grab a table that was not on top of theirs. The hostess got a bit of an attitude and seated up a couple rows down. I've also experienced attitude from their bar as well. I was rushed to place my order, rushed to order a drink, and rushed to pay, with not even a glimmer of positivity or a smile from anyone working the bar. It was so awkward! The food is pretty good, menu isn't very large. Drinks center around tequila. Their margs are pre-mixed and varied, their not totally terrible. I probably won't be visiting again. There are much better options in that shopping center.

VHA0Rtl_KZHdNs2P1Z3ttw.text: The ambiance is more tasteful than the food. Food wasn't bad, but It could of been better for what you're paying . They should also not be so stingy with the amount tequila poured in their drinks

D-G6tMaXlDQxfXv6VoMyKw.text: Top notch service at the bar. Kick @ss margaritas and the happy hour is ridiculously cheap. Tacos were tasty. Their 3 dip appetizer was somewhat of a let down though.

nyTc0BKuqDWk1SvUKhgezA.text: As huge fans of 80% of Sam Fox's restaurants (we don't eat meat), the Blanco at the Biltmore has a nice feel.  Normally we dine at their Scottsdale location and we miss Kelly Courson their Manager who moved to their newer Henry's restaurant.  The one thing we do notice at most of Sam's restaurants is that the Chef's seem to have different spins on their standard dishes.  Hence there can be disappointments and we have shared this at TFK in the past.  So of course there was a misunderstanding on a salad prep.  Marlo the Manager came over and could not have been more gracious about it all.    This while she was scratching her head why their Fish Salad comes as a chopped salad and the chopped salad does not.  Go figure!  Yet here is where Fox outshines most any other eatery here.  Their ability to attract talent and get these people into management positions is stellar.  Marlo was so earnest and  genuine in her TLC with us.  Outstanding !!!!  So yes there are some discrepancies, yet when the rubber meets the road, the Fox people are the BEST!!!

yUYa0a4M9vI5gYeCQHtRWw.text: After a  horrible day and work week, my husband and I decided to try out Blanco (the Biltmore location) for dinner.  We had been to the Blanco on Scottsdale road on a few previous occasions, but decided to venture to this location instead, to see if the experience would be any different.  My husband, baby daughter, and I arrived around 530 and the place was busy, but not yet packed. We were seated immediately and greeted by our waiter, Nathan.  To begin, we ordered a pitcher of White wine Sangria and a Chicken Quesadilla appetizer. Our waiter came back a little while later with our drinks and a basket of complimentary chips and salsa.  After about 25 minutes or so, the manager and our waiter came back to apologize for the wait on our appetizer and promised it would be out soon. A couple of minutes later our Quesadilla came out and about two minutes after, our dinners arrived as well.  The manager (I can't recall her name, but she was very, very nice) apologized profusely and offered to take our appetizer off of the bill.    My husband and I had both ordered the House Specialty (Shortrib) enchiladas- it's what we order every time we go. A few bites in, I noticed that my rice was quite mooshy.  I had intended to just eat around it, but my husband decided to mention it to our waiter, when he came back to check on us. A few minutes later, the manager arrived with a new side of rice and again apologized.  Our waiter then came back and stated that we would be receiving a free dessert for the inconvenience.  All in all, although there were a few minor hiccups, we would definitely come back because the degree of customer service that they provided was really commendable. Our server, Nathan, was fantastic and so too was the manager who came by to check on us.    Thank you for helping to make a horrible day/ work week better!

Yy_Y-nmrHi7w878RK2D4UQ.text: Great for gluten free eaters!! They don't have a gluten free menu, but are very knowledgable and accommodating. There are many menu options and they understand cross contamination! If you call ahead they will make sure you have gluten free chips for you too. Great food and good service! I have celiac disease and felt very safe eating there.

photos.caption: Photo of Blanco Tacos + Tequila - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gluten free chips, salsa, and queso dip!

o2ygIk_L4FFdCbgLrYIYoA.text: Service was great! Unfortunately, food and drinks did not match the staff's demeanor. Cold tacos, horrible drinks... If the food was as good at the staff, I might go back

WNdrXHlWRGK67juVwINthA.text: Love this place never have had a bad meal yet and the service is just as good. The prices are really good for the size you get and best tacos in that area.

zaXEFJMivt7H70YVsv876Q.text: Service was prompt, friendly, and efficient. We were given two baskets of fresh chips with salsa before our order arrived.  All selections were fresh, hot, and very tasty.  Five stars isn't high enough!

48Vw_L-0b2yKlXYBaZxrYg.text: It was my first time at this restaurant and the staff were very welcoming. The tables and seats were very clean which is rare in some other places. The food is great!! I love their grilled corn I would definitely recommend them. I had the shrimp, chicken, and carne asada tacos each one was better than the other. The shrimp and crab ceviche was also excellent. Overall, great experience and I will be back again soon.

A9ogHSdvM9Dkq4eMQgkwFA.text: Nice ambiance but horrible service. The food was good but not exceptional. Our drinks were empty more often than not.  We were served guacamole without chips for at least 15 min, and only given one silverware roll for two people. We asked for another and the girl nodded and never came back. We're not going back.

ACU8U1xGpGaYHlM46fN1ew.text: I have no idea why this place has so many stars. I wish I would of just ate at amc espenade now. First, it took so long to have our waiter greet us and get our drink orders. This was my first time here, my friends had been at the original Blanco several times.  They were craving the nachos.  Now typically when a menu item has been changed either your server will tell you or the menu will state the change.  Neither happened in this situation.  My friends didn't like the taste of the nachos and they specifically asked for no cream on them.  It came with cream on the bottom and both girls are lactose intolerant.  This ruined the dinner. The nachos were sent back and my friends had upset stomachs the rest of the night.  My meal was the short rib tacos.  These were actually good but this is AZ and good tacos are expected anywhere.  They claimed I was getting borracho beans. These beans were just refried and not smashed all the way.  I will not be reccomending this place and to have a restaurant in such a nice location you have to really step up your game Blanco

4nN0A4NQFYEdNIOzVVua2g.text: Tried Blanco taco for the first time today.  The restaurant is trendy, clean and the open air was inviting.   The service was great.  They brought a large bowl of chips with sufficient sauce.   The tacos looked good and the skillet enchilada was very unique, and had not seen enchiladas served like this anywhere else.  I personally like enchiladas and this skillet version looked fabulous but did not deliver on taste, serving size (small) and even though we ordered chicken enchilada there was hardly any chicken.   I see other reviews where people like this unique dish, so I recommend you try it and see for yourself.  Overall a nice restaurant.

Nfzv9RuB2zm9-JjznYKqBQ.text: I have eaten here a couple of times in the last month...once for dinner and once for lunch. Both times the food was very good - we especially liked the guacamole and chips ! I had the braised tacos for dinner and the green pork enchilada for lunch and would recommend either one. There is a very nice manager ( his name is Daniel ) that was so helpful and he stopped by to check on us a couple of times...it seemed like the wait staff enjoyed working with him and the place was high energy and fun !

wsAiZ5jLhO_CmunCYfddqg.text: my wife and I hose blanco for lunch and upon arriving I was placed on a wait list for a table. I was told, by the hostess, that i would be recieving a text alert for my table. Waited for about 20 minutes and saw 3 tables being seated after walking right in with no wait. I went to speak with the hostess and she was rather rude to me and said that she sent the message and nothing can be done. Not tolerable for the class of eatery

BQHMwHKWSXNjftAxmpKA-w.text: Service was terrible. The restaurant was not even half full on a Sunday afternoon. It took over an hour to get our food, Thirty minutes to get our drinks. Food was decent but not worth the wait. Won't be coming back.

zs3lYAkc7eDWPqY1cUrDhQ.text: OMG!!! My friend brought me here for my first time and I loved the place and atmosphere. Our server was Maddy. She was so sweet and was on top of it when it came to our service. She was always smiling and she gave me a great recommendation for the green enchiladas. They were AWESOME!!!!
